page.title: 08Religion Shenley & Whaddon
page.content: Whaddon has 2 places of worship: the fine 12th C parish church dedicated to St Mary & a Congregational church built in 1907. Whaddon has no resident clergyman but is served from nearby Newton Longville. Shenley's Norman parish church, is also dedicated to St Mary & shares its rector with the next village, Loughton. Both Shenley & Loughton form the core of a large residential development in Milton Keynes.The in-coming population brings new life to the church & necessitates new forms of ministry. Congregations gather in community buildings on the new estates, & plan new churches for the future. Some Shenley villagers belong to Loughton Baptist church a very active church serving a wider area than 2 villages. Roman catholics travel to Bletchley.
